messages.text:
*** Submitted as http://code.google.com/p/go/source/detail?r=d95fa9a7d6c5 ***

doc: fix snapshot notes

R=bradfitz, dsymonds
CC=golang-dev
http://codereview.appspot.com/5675056

Hello bradfitz (cc: golang-dev@googlegroups.com),

I'd like you to review this change to
https://go.googlecode.com/hg

LGTM

*File.Fd() also returns uintptr now, instead of int (matching NewFile)


On Wed, Feb 15, 2012 at 2:17 PM, <adg@golang.org> wrote:

> Reviewers: bradfitz,
>
> Message:
> Hello bradfitz (cc: golang-dev@googlegroups.com),
>
> I'd like you to review this change to
> https://go.googlecode.com/hg
>
>
> Description:
> doc: fix snapshot notes
>
> Please review this at http://codereview.appspot.com/**5675056/<http://codereview.appspot.com/5675056/>
>
> Affected files:
>  M doc/devel/weekly.html
>
>
> Index: doc/devel/weekly.html
> ==============================**==============================**=======
> --- a/doc/devel/weekly.html
> +++ b/doc/devel/weekly.html
> @@ -22,8 +22,8 @@
>  The flate, gzip and zlib's NewWriterXxx functions no longer return an
> error.
>  The compiler will flag all affected code which must then be updated by
> hand.
>
> -The os package's Exec and Time functions were removed. Callers should use
> the
> -os/exec package and time.Now instead. The ShellExpand function was
> renamed to
> +The os package's Exec and Time functions were removed. Callers should use
> +syscall.Exec and time.Now instead. The ShellExpand function was renamed to
>  ExpandEnv. The NewFile function now takes a uintptr.
>
>  The runtime package's Type type and its methods have been removed.
>
>
>

subject: code review 5675056: doc: fix snapshot notes
